title: Ex-MasterChef judges return for a Channel Seven cooking show, minus George
text:
Channel Seven is expected to announce its latest cooking show, starring two former MasterChef judges, at its Upfronts presentation in Sydney on Wednesday.

According to industry rumours, Matt Preston and Gary Mehigan will host the as-yet-untitled program with radio personality and comedian Jane Kennedy.

Fellow MasterChef judge George Calombaris, whose public image has taken a battering this year after a series of scandals, is reportedly not involved in the project.

Industry rumours: Channel Seven is expected to announce its latest cooking show, starring former MasterChef judges Matt Preston (right) and Gary Mehigan (left), at its Upfronts presentation in Sydney on Wednesday night

Tellingly, Jane refused to deny the rumours on her Triple M drive time show, Kennedy Molloy, on Tuesday afternoon.

During a discussion with her co-host, Mick Molloy, she was asked directly about the speculation but didn't give anything away.

'The Channel Seven Upfronts are on Wednesday and I believe there'll be some sort of announcement about a cooking show involving them and you?' Mick said.

Meet the new George! According to industry rumours, Matt Preston and Gary Mehigan will host the as-yet-untitled project with radio personality and comedian Jane Kennedy (pictured)

'I beg your pardon? Me? I don't know what you're talking about!' replied Jane, who has previously released four cookbooks.

Playing coy, she added: 'I don't know where you hear these rumours from. You know I get on great with those guys, they're great friends.

'All I will say is you know I love cooking, I love food.'

Boned! Fellow MasterChef judge George Calombaris (pictured), whose public image has taken a battering this year after a series of scandals, is reportedly not involved in the project

Mick gave his colleague the opportunity to deny the rumours, but she simply responded: 'No comment.'

According to TV Blackbox, Gary and Matt's Channel Seven project 'is expected to premiere in August after the 2020 Summer Olympics.'

It comes after the Herald Sun reported on Saturday that Matt and Gary are 'cooking up a new show with Seven' following their departure from MasterChef.

Suddenly shy? Tellingly, Jane refused to deny the rumours on her Triple M drive time show, Kennedy Molloy, on Tuesday afternoon. Pictured with her radio co-host Mick Molloy (right)

Multi-talented: In addition to being a TV and radio personality, Jane has previously released four cookbooks. Pictured on Have You Been Paying Attention?

Seven's new CEO James Warburton, who is the former chief executive of Channel 10, is apparently hoping the pair will 'reinvigorate' the network's culinary programming.

But George has supposedly been 'left off the list' after he admitted to underpaying his restaurant staff at MAdE Establishment by nearly $8million.

Matt, Gary and George were dumped from MasterChef in July this year, after Channel 10 refused to meet their salary demands.

The trio had hosted the popular cooking show for 11 seasons.
description: Channel Seven is expected to announce its latest cooking show, starring two former MasterChef judges, at its Upfronts presentation in Sydney on Wednesday.
authors: Jo Scrimshire For Daily Mail Australia
